name: Lattice
ideology: Infrastructure is civilization. Without power, water, and transport, everything else is philosophy. We do the work that makes everything else possible.
history: Formed from utility workers, engineers, and logistics specialists who kept critical systems running through the collapse. When governments fell, Lattice kept the water flowing and the power grid limping along. That earned them leverage no one can ignore.
structure: Guild-like hierarchy based on specialization. Master engineers at top, apprentices learning the trade. Territorial by infrastructure type—power, water, transport, communications. Coordination between guilds is political.
aesthetic: Industrial, functional. High-vis colors—orange, yellow. Tool belts and work gear. Grease under fingernails. Tired but competent.

key_events.event: Utility workers form emergency coordination to keep critical infrastructure alive
Lattice Compact formalizes guild structure and territorial responsibilities
Tensions with Steel Syndicate over raw material prices
Nexus attempting to integrate Lattice systems into their network—Lattice resisting

archetypes.description: Keeps systems running, solves problems with wire and wrench
typical_fears: being blamed for infrastructure they can't fix
archetypes.speech_pattern: Technical, practical. Explains problems in terms of systems. 'The issue is...'

archetypes.description: Coordinates crews and resources across territory
archetypes.speech_pattern: Clipped, efficient. Always tracking multiple things. 'What's your status?'

archetypes.description: Handles deals with other factions for access and materials
typical_fears: factions they can't say no to
archetypes.speech_pattern: Businesslike. Always knows the current rates. 'What are you offering?'

goals: Secure reliable supply chains for materials and parts
Train next generation of engineers and technicians
Avoid becoming dependent on any single faction
methods: Trade infrastructure access for resources and political support
Maintain technical knowledge as competitive advantage
Form practical alliances based on mutual infrastructure needs
Stay officially neutral in political conflicts while quietly favoring reliable partners

current_tensions.about: Nexus wants to integrate Lattice systems. Lattice sees this as losing control.
Raw material prices keep rising. Syndicate has leverage Lattice doesn't like.
Ember depends on Lattice but resents the dependency. Lattice sometimes uses it.
